name: The Inn at Cranborne

reviews.text: We took our 18 year old son and Westie for a stay at this wonderful hotel. Jane and her staff are great hosts.
reviews.title: Delightful and restful stay with dog

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was the best, even better than at home and we all felt completely rested even though we only stayed for one night.
reviews.title: Excellent food and atmosphere

reviews.text: Had lunch here yesterday and I was very impressed. The Inn has been beautifully renovated. It's stylish and relaxed. Great staff, very friendly and helpful. The food was excellent, delicious and well presented. We will definately be going back.
reviews.title: Accommodation & Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best hotel and restaurant in the village, newly refurbished the accommodation is first class. the restaurant is in the bar area but with the log fire and the welcoming atmosphere and the well cooked food , what more could you ask for. The staff are all very helpful and cheerful. Look out for their special deals and grab one!
reviews.title: Delighted

reviews.text: Excellent lunch of steak & kidney pudding - hard to find these days but this one worth the search. The vegetables including shredded cabbage cooked to perfection.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful weekend away. The rooms are lovely & very clean.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fresh coffee in the room is a great touch.
reviews.title: Fantastic hideaway

reviews.text: The staff are excellent & nothing was too much trouble. The chef Edward
reviews.title: A luxurious delight

reviews.text: was brilliant who put himself out to make our stay exceptional & amusing!
reviews.title: Top quality pub food and a relaxing atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beer was great & a very lovely atmosphere in the bar when the locals were in.
reviews.title: Fantastic bolt hole for weekend in the country - dog chic too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night, 1st September, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room, the Cranborne Chase was lovely, especially bearing in mind it was for one night only. The shower was very spacious with plenty of hot water and there were lovely fluffy towels. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. There were 'proper clothes hangers and hairdryer', so much better than the fixed hotel type. There was a noise from the extractor unit and the manager assured us that everything possible was being done to eliminate this.(we have stayed in three other places lately who also had this problem). The staff were very friendly and efficient. Dinner and breakfast was of a very high standard. Yes we will visit again next time we are in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent stopover

reviews.text: Everything about this place made me happy. From the good lighting and nice decor to the nice staff and really good food. I visited twice in a day... Once for tea and a chat and then for a Saturday night meal. Lovely soup and a Stilton Burger as good as I once had at Fortnum and Mason in Piccadily. I also asked for it a certain way and it was exact and amazing.
reviews.title: Village inn with the human touch....friendly and accommodating in every respect.

reviews.text: Even the burger relish is home made.
reviews.title: Great food and wonderful atmosphere!

reviews.text: Well done guys. There was no phone signal so the barman gave me his iPhone to use.... Need I say more. Try that in Chelsea....not a chance!
reviews.title: Not a great night away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not from the area but thought we would stop in for some dinner! Lovely pub with wonderful decor and it felt really homely. The menu had a number of nice options, the steak and ale pie was delicious! They have table games avalible for you to play while you wait and my fiancé and I had great fun with them. We did order a pudding between us as they were a little expensive for the size, and when it and out it was a bit solid - however the lovely waitress replaced it free of charge, and that sort of excellent customer service deserves five stars. If we are ever passing again we will stop for more of your lovely food!
reviews.title: Quality accommodation

reviews.text: We took our two daughters (aged13 and 9) and two of our friends for Sunday lunch. Having driven past and seen it being refurbished and smartened up considerably we were interested to see what it was like. The sample menus on the website looked great - a real mixture of pub classics and gastro pub style food.
reviews.title: Lovely Sunday lunch

reviews.text: It certainly is a smart modern bar/restaurant interior although keeping some older features - like a good warehouse conversion. Service was good and our whole party enjoyed 3 courses of delicious food. Sternest critics youngest daughter demolished a cod and chorizo dish and eldest the roast beef - so it must be good. Banoffee Eton Mess dessert was intriguing but so glad we ordered it - fab!
reviews.title: Nice b&b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would be very happy to go again!
reviews.title: I don't want to tell you...just how good it was.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A comfortable place to stay. Good food and beer. Plenty of outdoor space for a drink in the sunshine. A decent find and reasonably priced for a one or two night stay. Staff made us welcome. Lovely part of Dorset.
reviews.title: High level comfort and style

reviews.text: First Impressions
reviews.title: Hidden gem!!!

description: Within this 17th Century building, Jane Gould has brought about her own vision of a traditional English Country Inn. Amongst the wood burning stoves, cosy corners and sharing tables you will find hearty interesting food, lovingly restored bedrooms featuring large beds with snuggly duvets and a choice of pillows and fabulous en-suite bathrooms with powerful showers, some roll-top baths and Bramley products.The daily changing menu is interesting but not overwhelming and there is always great range of well-kept Real Ales, including the Inn’s own Fleur Ale, brewed specially by Hall & Woodhouse.The Inn at Cranborne is fast becoming a focal point of the delightful village of Cranborne, set as it is in the heart of Cranborne Chase with its ample opportunities for fishing and shooting. It is a short drive to the New Forest, the beautiful Jurassic Coast and the sandy beaches of Bournemouth. Winborne, Salisbury, Shaftesbury and many gardens and historic places are within an easy drive. The area is also great for cycling and walking, with Jubilee trail right on our doorstep.
